topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Configuring LDAP CLI Support

body.p: By default, the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade services are configured to use Keystone v2 authorization. The services need to be modified to use Keystone v3. You will not be able to execute OpenStack CLI commands until the following changes are made on all three controller nodes in the non-KVM region.
You should have downloaded the patch files in the Prerequisites.
To configure HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade services to use Keystone v3:

ol.li: Copy the ldap_patch_1.1.tar.gz and hoscg-update.tgz files to the ~/patch_cghelion1.1 directory. cp ldap_patch_1.1.tar.gz ~/patch_cghelion1.1 cp hoscg-update.tgz ~/patch_cghelion1.1
Use the following command to extract the patches: tar -zxvf ldap_patch_1.1.tar.gz tar -zxvf hoscg-update.tgz

section.title: Modify the stackrc files
section.p: The stackrc file is a configuration file that contains all of the settings that control the supported services and the repositories used to download the source for those services.

ol.li: On the HLM host, use the following commands to modify the /root/stackrc file with values appropriate to your environment, using the following example. export OS_PASSWORD=admin export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_TENANT_NAME=admin export OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.200.52.100:5000/v2.0 export OS_CACERT=/etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt export OS_REGION_NAME=memphis unset OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME unset OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID unset OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION unset OS_AUTH_VERSION unset OS_PROJECT_NAME
Execute the following commands to source the - /root/stackrcv3 file: source stackrcv3
Execute the following OpenStack CLI command to create a new project: openstack project create ldapdemo --domain americas
Execute the following command to list all user names: openstack user list --domain Americas
Make note of the ID number for the cg-ldap-admin user.
Execute the following command to add the cg-ldap-admin user (from the previous step) as an admin to the project you created as an admin. openstack role add --user <user id> --project ldapdemo admin

Create a text file with the LDAP username/password, project/tenant name, domain name and ID, Identity service API version, and other values as shown: export OS_USERNAME=<ldapusername> export OS_PASSWORD=<ldapuserpassword> export OS_PROJECT_NAME=ldapdemo export OS_TENANT_NAME=ldapdemo export OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=americas export OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID=<DOMAIN_GUID> export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_URL=<CAN_AUTH_URL> #export OS_AUTH_URL=<CLM_AUTH_URL> export OS_CACERT=/etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt export OS_REGION_NAME=memphis
The file should appears similar to the following:export OS_USERNAME=cg-ldap export OS_PASSWORD=cg-ldap export OS_PROJECT_NAME=ldapdemo export OS_TENANT_NAME=ldapdemo export OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=americas export OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID=48b0aac906394e99855af16bfdbd9d32 export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.20.4.100:5000/v3 #export OS_AUTH_URL=http://10.20.3.103:35357/v3 export OS_CACERT=/etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt export OS_REGION_NAME=regionone
Save the files as stackrcv3, replacing the existing file.

body.section:
Install the HP Identity Operations (Keystone) package on all the controllers
On the HLM host, change to the to the ~/<cloudname> directory.cd ~/<cloudname>
Execute the following command, using your cloudname and failure-zone: hupdate -c <cloudname> -f <failureZone> hoscg-update.tgz
Where:<ul id="ul_lcw_gbs_bt">
<cloudname> is the name of your cloud;
<failurezone> is controller mapping can be obtained from <cloud-directory>/nodes.json file on HLM node.
Execute this command on all three non-KVM controllers, using a different failure zone for each. section.title: Configure Controllers
section.p: On each of the three non-KVM region conrollers, you meed to perform the following tasks:

ol.li:
Replace the /etc/keystone/keystone-paste.ini file on all three controllers. From the HLM host, execute the following command for each controller:scp ~/~/patch_cghelion1.1/keystone-paste.ini cghelion@<controller-ip>
Where: <controller-ip> is the IP address for each controller.
Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file to comment out the following line: #auth_version = 2.0
Edit the /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf file to comment out the following line: #auth_version = 2.0

Modify Cinder and Glance INI files by making the following change:
Replace paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory
With: paste.filter_factory = keystonemiddleware.auth_token:filter_factory
In the following files:
/etc/cinder/api-paste.ini
/etc/glance/glance-api-paste.ini
/etc/glance/glance-registry-paste.ini
/etc/glance/glance-registry.conf
Execute the following commands to restart affected OpenStack services: service glance-registry restart service glance-api restart service cinder-api restart service nova-api restart

Execute a glance image-list command.glance image-list
